thread.title_full: Which U.S. cities are among the most 'pinned' travel... | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Zach Dennis
title: Which U.S. cities are among the most 'pinned' travel... | www.palmbeachpost.com
text:
You may not be able to travel to there, but it won’t stop you from pinning it on Pinterest.
The social media site created a list of the “most pinned” travel destinations in the world, or the locations its users were most interested in visiting, according to the Huffington Post . While no Florida cities made the cut, the United States had three big cities and a couple small beauties in the rankings.
Glacier National Park New York City, New Orleans and Los Angeles made the list, along with the beautiful sites of Glacier National Park in Montana and Havasu Falls in the Grand Canyon in Arizona.
According to the site, Glacier National Park contains “more than 700 miles of hiking trails” containing “stunning scenery.” Havasu Falls are hidden from normal view, but the Huffington Post notes that those interested can reach them with a hike.
Other listed spots include: Reykjavik, Iceland; Cape Town, South Africa; Lisbon, Portugal; Kyoto, Japan; Musha City Island, Bahamas; and Positano, Campania in Italy.
Read more at the Huffington Post and on Pinterest .
</span
